title: Nothing Phone (3) Might Launch On March 2025, CEO Carl Pei's Email Leaks - HerZindagi
summary:
Nothing Phone (3) Might Launch On March 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: HerZindagi

Recently, a leaked email from CEO Carl Pei provided insights into the anticipated Nothing Phone (3), expected to launch in March 2025.

  • The Nothing Phone (3) aims to build on the success of its predecessor, the Nothing Phone (2).
  • The email emphasizes a focus on improved user interface design and integration of artificial intelligence.
  • The internal email titled, '2025: Nothing’s Year Of Innovation,' was shared by tipster Evan Blass.
  • No specific launch date was mentioned, but speculation points to March 2025.
  • Aside from smartphones, Nothing is also set to release innovative audio devices.
“The upcoming phone will be focused on a much more improved user interface design powered by ever-evolving artificial intelligence.” - Carl Pei

This new launch demonstrates Nothing's commitment to enhancing user experience and embracing innovation in its products.
newTitle: Nothing Phone (3) Launch Expected in March 2025 Following CEO Email Leak

Deadly 'zombie deer' disease could evolve to affect humans, warn scientists - The Times of India
summary:
Deadly 'Zombie Deer' Disease Could Evolve to Affect Humans, Warn Scientists

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Daily Mail

Scientists warn that the incurable prion disease known as Chronic Wasting Disease (CWD), primarily affecting deer, could evolve to infect humans, potentially leading to severe health consequences.

  • The disease has already been reported in feral pigs and could spill over to domestic swine.
  • CWD exhibits symptoms similar to dementia in infected animals, such as drooling and aggression.
  • Currently found in at least 33 states, including Wyoming and Wisconsin.
  • There are concerns about human exposure through consumption of infected meat.
  • The disease is highly contagious among deer and other hoofed animals.
"If they can get infected, surely it's possible domestic swine could also become infected? What would that do to the swine market?" - Dr. Michael Osterholm

Experts express urgency for preparedness as the potential spillover of CWD to humans could lead to a health crisis.
newTitle: Deadly 'Zombie Deer' Disease Could Evolve to Affect Humans, Warn Scientists

UPSC cheating case: Puja Khedkar seeks pre-arrest bail, moves Supreme Court - Deccan Herald
summary:
UPSC Cheating Case: Puja Khedkar Seeks Pre-Arrest Bail in Supreme Court

Date: 14 January 2025, Source: Unknown

The appellant, Puja Khedkar, is accused of cheating to secure benefits under the OBC quota for the UPSC exams. She seeks to overturn the High Court's decision against her bail application.

  • Puja Khedkar is alleged to have fraudulently obtained benefits as an OBC candidate for UPSC examinations.
  • The High Court rejected her plea, citing a strong prima facie case against her.
  • UPSC lodged an FIR against her, claiming she falsely identified herself as a PwBD candidate.
  • The court noted discrepancies in her declared family income and her family's wealth.
  • On July 31, 2024, her provisional candidature was canceled, and she was permanently debarred from UPSC exams.
  • Previous plea for anticipatory bail was dismissed by a Delhi court on August 8, 2024.
“The present incident is a classic example of fraud committed not only with a constitutional body but the society at large.”

This case highlights ongoing concerns regarding integrity in public service examinations and the possible ramifications of fraudulent actions.
newTitle: UPSC Cheating Case: Puja Khedkar Seeks Pre-Arrest Bail in Supreme Court

title: Wholesale Price Inflation Rises To 2.37% In December - News18
summary:
Wholesale Price Inflation Rises to 2.37% in December

Publication Date: January 14, 2025  |  Source: News18

Wholesale price inflation rose to 2.37% in December 2024, driven by a spike in manufactured products, while prices of food items saw a decrease.

  • Inflation registered at 1.89% in November 2024 and 0.86% in December 2023.
  • Food inflation eased to 8.47% in December from 8.63% in November.
  • Vegetable inflation stood at 28.65% in December.
  • High inflation recorded in potatoes at 93.20% and onions at 16.81%.
  • Deflation in the fuel and power category was noted at 3.79% in December, a decrease from 5.83% in November.
  • Manufactured items saw an increase in inflation to 2.14% from 2% in November.
Retail inflation eased to a 4-month low of 5.22% in December due to declining food prices.

This rise in wholesale price inflation reflects ongoing pressures in certain sectors while some food items experience a relief from rising costs.
newTitle: Wholesale Price Inflation Rises to 2.37% in December

title: Rupee hits new low of 86.69 per dollar as oil importers boost demand - Business Standard
summary:
Rupee Hits New Low of 86.69 Per Dollar as Oil Importers Boost Demand

Publication Date: Tuesday

Source: Market News

The Indian rupee hit a fresh low of 86.69 per dollar (intra-day) on Tuesday due to increased demand from foreign investors and oil importers.

  • The rupee closed at 86.64 per dollar, marking a significant depreciation.
  • In the current financial year, the rupee has depreciated by 3.73%.
  • RBI's intervention was minimal amid high demand for dollars.
  • Benchmark government bond yields softened slightly, indicating market adjustments.
  • Market analysts expect the rupee could approach 87 per dollar soon.
“Positive buying in the capital markets, particularly in PSU stocks...could lend further strength.” - Jateen Trivedi, VP Research Analyst

The article points to the growing pressure on the rupee and suggests potential future trends based on market factors and demand.
newTitle: Rupee Hits New Low of 86.69 Per Dollar Amid Rising Demand

Fake Brad Pitt uses love poems, AI photos to swindle French woman out of ₹7 crore - Hindustan Times
summary:
Scammer Posing as Brad Pitt Defrauds French Woman of ₹7 Crore

Date: Jan 14, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A scammer impersonating Brad Pitt has defrauded a French woman named Anne out of over 800,000 euros for fake medical treatment. The scam involved convincing her through messages and AI-generated content that he needed financial assistance due to a blocked bank account stemming from a supposed divorce.

  • The scammer first contacted Anne pretending to be Pitt's mother.
  • He sent AI-generated videos and photos to maintain the illusion of being the actor.
  • Anne, believing she was in a relationship with Pitt, was eventually prompted to send substantial amounts of money under false pretenses.
  • She faced severe emotional distress leading to hospitalization after realizing the deception.
  • Anne is one of several women targeted by scammers posing as the actor.
“I liked the man I was talking to and he knew how to talk to women,” Anne stated.

This incident highlights the growing threat of online scams and the emotional and financial toll they can take on victims.
newTitle: Scammer Posing as Brad Pitt Defrauds French Woman of ₹7 Crore

Why Retail Inflation Was Less Burdensome Despite Being Over 5% in December

January 14, 2025 / Moneycontrol

This article discusses the reasons why retail inflation, despite remaining above 5%, felt less impactful in December, marking the first time in ten months that approximately 75 items experienced deflation.

  • Retail inflation has been above 5% for several months.
  • December saw deflation in around 75 items, providing relief to consumers.
  • The article examines contributing factors to reduced inflationary pressure.
This marks the first time in 10 months that around 75 items witnessed deflation.

The article highlights key trends in inflation and consumer experiences, indicating a complex economic environment.

Release all Indians serving in Russian military, says India after one more death - Hindustan Times
summary:
India Calls for Release of Nationals Serving in Russian Military After Latest Death

Publication Date: Jan 14, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

India has demanded the release of all Indian nationals serving in the Russian military after the death of another citizen, raising the death toll to 10. The Ministry of External Affairs has strongly addressed the issue with Russian authorities, following repeated calls for the release of Indian support staff involved with the military.

  • One Indian national from Kerala was killed, another injured in conflict-related incidents.
  • Prime Minister Modi has previously taken up the issue with President Putin.
  • A total of 85 Indian nationals had been discharged last year, with efforts ongoing for 20 more.
  • Recruitment of Indians into the Russian military has been under scrutiny; many were reportedly misled by agents.
“We have learned of the unfortunate death of an Indian national from Kerala who had apparently been recruited to serve in the Russian Army,” - Randhir Jaiswal, External Affairs Ministry Spokesperson.

The Indian government is working to repatriate the deceased's remains and assist the injured individual while maintaining contact with families affected by the situation.
newTitle: India Calls for Release of Nationals Serving in Russian Military After Latest Death

title: Ex-IAS trainee Puja Khedkar moves Supreme Court for anticipatory bail - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Seeks Anticipatory Bail from Supreme Court

Published on: 14 Jan 2025, 12:06 pm

Former IAS trainee Puja Khedkar has approached the Supreme Court to challenge the Delhi High Court's rejection of her anticipatory bail plea amid allegations of fraud related to reservation benefits.

  • Khedkar is accused of fraudulently availing reservation for OBC and Persons with Disabilities for UPSC exam.
  • The FIR cites existing documents in possession of the prosecution, suggesting no need for custodial interrogation.
  • She claims lack of criminal antecedents and entitlements under the All India Services Act and Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act.
  • UPSC has cancelled her selection and barred her from future exams due to these allegations.
  • The High Court initially granted Khedkar interim protection but subsequently vacated it, establishing a prima facie case against her.
“The material revealed that she was not a fit candidate for such benefits and that she had forged documents.” - Justice Chandra Dhari Singh

Khedkar's case reflects larger issues surrounding the integrity of public service examinations and the reservation system.
newTitle: Ex-IAS Trainee Puja Khedkar Seeks Anticipatory Bail from Supreme Court

title: Fibre in diet can reduce risk of gut infections: 6 ways to add more fibre in meals - The Times of India
summary:
Fibre in Diet Can Reduce Risk of Gut Infections: 6 Ways to Add More Fibre in Meals

Date: December 8, 2023 | Source: IANS

The article discusses the importance of dietary fibre in reducing the risk of gut infections and suggests six practical ways to incorporate more fibre into meals.

  • Start the Day Right: Choose high-fibre breakfast options like whole-grain cereals or muesli topped with fruits and nuts.
  • Whole Grains Over Refined: Swap refined grains for whole grains like brown rice, quinoa, and whole-wheat bread.
  • Load Up on Fruits and Vegetables: Incorporate a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables into your diet for added fibre and nutrients.
  • Add Lentils and Beans: Use lentils, chickpeas, and beans in soups, salads, and stews for a fibre boost.
  • Choose Nuts and Seeds: Snack on nuts and seeds instead of less healthy options to increase your fibre intake.
  • Opt for Fibre-Enriched Foods: Look for packaged snacks and drinks labelled as high in fibre, but check ingredient lists for sugar and unhealthy fats.
“Dietary fiber reduces the chance of heart disease, type 2 diabetes, and some types of cancer.”

By incorporating these strategies, individuals can significantly boost their fibre intake, supporting overall gut health and reducing the risk of infections.
newTitle: Fibre in Diet Can Reduce Gut Infection Risk: 6 Simple Ways to Increase Intake

title: First full Moon of 2025: Will Wolf Moon be visible from India; know details - Business Standard
summary:
First Full Moon of 2025: Wolf Moon and Lunar Occultation Details

Date: Today

Source: Unspecified

The first full moon of 2025, known as the Wolf Moon, features a rare occurrence where it will pass in front of Mars, leading to a lunar occultation.

Key Points:

  • The lunar occultation occurs as the moon obscures Mars, which is approximately 40,000 times brighter.
  • The full moon peaks at 3:57 AM IST.
  • The Wolf Moon is named for the active howling of wolves in January.
  • This celestial event can be viewed using telescopes or binoculars, as Mars will not be visible from India.
No, the first full moon of January 2025 wouldn't be visible from India.

Only locations in the contiguous United States and parts of Canada will witness this spectacular event.
newTitle: First Full Moon of 2025: Wolf Moon and Lunar Occultation Details

title: Hamas has accepted draft agreement for Gaza ceasefire, release of hostages: officials - The Hindu
summary:
Hamas has accepted draft agreement for Gaza ceasefire, release of hostages: officials

Date: January 14, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Hamas has confirmed acceptance of a draft agreement for a ceasefire in Gaza and the release of hostages, according to officials involved in the negotiations. Mediators from Qatar announced that talks are at their most promising stage.

  • Hamas’ acceptance marks a critical step in negotiations mediated by the U.S., Egypt, and Qatar.
  • About 100 Israelis are held hostage, with many believed to be deceased.
  • The agreement includes a three-phase plan for releasing hostages and a humanitarian aid surge.
  • Upcoming U.S. presidential inauguration adds urgency to reach a final deal.
“Today, we are at the closest point ever to having a deal,” said Qatari Foreign Ministry spokesman Majed al-Ansari.

In conclusion, there seems to be a significant movement towards a potential ceasefire and a resolution that could reshape the current conflict landscape in Gaza.
newTitle: Hamas Accepts Ceasefire Agreement for Gaza and Hostage Release
